title: Drawing, "Candelabrum as part of decoration", ca. 1480–1500
medium: Pen, ink, brush, brown watercolor, white heightening on red colored paper.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. Cut along the outlines of the drawing. Supported by a blossom and two lion feet. The lower part has the shape of a pedestal, shown from one corner, the plan being above angular, below circular. Rising rinceaux are in the panels, in those visible. The shaft is of vegetable forms, intermixed with metal ones. On top is a shell rising from leaves.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Candelabrum as part of decoration", ca. 1480–1500.
ca. 1480–1500. Pen, ink, brush, brown watercolor, white heightening on red colored paper.. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6980.
